fields.value: The Democratic Deficit on Salient Issues: Immigration and Healthcare in the States

dsDescriptionValue.value: State policy data from 2014 on four immigration issues (bilingual education, in-state tuition, drivers' licenses, and E-Verify) and three healthcare issues (doctor-assisted suicide, medical marijuana, and SCHIP). Also includes data from the 2014 University of Georgia module of the Cooperative Congressional Election study on these seven issues and forecasts of overall state issue opinion using multilevel regression with poststratification.

files.description: Tabular form of demographic data from the 2014 American Community Survey. Aggregated from IPUMS data.
files.label: ACS2014_poststratification.tab

dataFile.description: Tabular form of demographic data from the 2014 American Community Survey. Aggregated from IPUMS data.

files.description: Subset of the 2014 Cooperative Congressional Election Study common content. Includes all observations, but only the variables of Case ID, survey weight, state, and ideological self-identification. Citizen ideology measures were produced by aggregating these data.
files.label: CCES14_Common_OUTPUT_subset.tab

dataFile.description: Subset of the 2014 Cooperative Congressional Election Study common content. Includes all observations, but only the variables of Case ID, survey weight, state, and ideological self-identification. Citizen ideology measures were produced by aggregating these data.

files.description: Subset of the University of Georgia's module from the 2014 Cooperative Congressional Election Study. Includes all 1000 observations, but only the necessary variables. These are Case ID, opinion on the seven policy issues of relevance, state, region, birth year, sex, education, and race.
files.label: CCES14_UGA_OUTPUT_subset.tab

dataFile.description: Subset of the University of Georgia's module from the 2014 Cooperative Congressional Election Study. Includes all 1000 observations, but only the necessary variables. These are Case ID, opinion on the seven policy issues of relevance, state, region, birth year, sex, education, and race.

files.description: Stata code to measure citizen ideology with the 2014 CCES common content, applying the Erikson, Wright, and McIver (1993) formula. Requires the input file of CCES14_Common_OUTPUT_subset.dta.
files.label: CCESideologyMeasure.do

dataFile.description: Stata code to measure citizen ideology with the 2014 CCES common content, applying the Erikson, Wright, and McIver (1993) formula. Requires the input file of CCES14_Common_OUTPUT_subset.dta.

files.description: The primary replication code file. R code to reproduce every table and figure in the article, except for the appendix table reporting the multilevel models of public opinion. The output from this program includes graphing state-level estimates of public opinion with characters representing policy, the policy liberalism models, and the policy congruence models. Required input files are healthImmigLONG.dta, LaxPhillipsAJPSmodified.csv, and interactions.oneatatime.R.
files.label: demDefAnalysis.R

dataFile.description: The primary replication code file. R code to reproduce every table and figure in the article, except for the appendix table reporting the multilevel models of public opinion. The output from this program includes graphing state-level estimates of public opinion with characters representing policy, the policy liberalism models, and the policy congruence models. Required input files are healthImmigLONG.dta, LaxPhillipsAJPSmodified.csv, and interactions.oneatatime.R.

files.description: Documentation describing the contents of the data files and software code associated with this project. Includes a full codebook for healthImmigLONG.dta.
files.label: docDemDef.rtf

dataFile.description: Documentation describing the contents of the data files and software code associated with this project. Includes a full codebook for healthImmigLONG.dta.

files.description: One of two primary replication data files. 2014 state policies on four immigration and three health issues, as well as estimates of state-level public support for each of the seven issues. The data also include several control variables, including citizen ideology, government ideology, partisan control, and institutional features of the state.
files.label: healthImmigLONG.tab

dataFile.description: One of two primary replication data files. 2014 state policies on four immigration and three health issues, as well as estimates of state-level public support for each of the seven issues. The data also include several control variables, including citizen ideology, government ideology, partisan control, and institutional features of the state.

files.description: R code, called by demDefAnalysis.R, that estimates several robustness checks of the responsiveness model by only considering one interaction term at a time.
files.label: interactions.oneatatime.R

dataFile.description: R code, called by demDefAnalysis.R, that estimates several robustness checks of the responsiveness model by only considering one interaction term at a time.

files.description: Excel spreadsheet recording New York Times coverage of 39 policy issues in 2008 and 2014.
files.label: issueSalience.xlsx

dataFile.description: Excel spreadsheet recording New York Times coverage of 39 policy issues in 2008 and 2014.

files.description: One of two primary replication data files. Replication data from Lax & Phillips (2012). Includes state policies on 39 issues in 2008, as well as state-level public support for each of the policies. The data also include 2008 levels of several control variables. We adjusted the coding of legislative and gubernatorial party opposition so that Democrats are opposed to conservative public preferences and Republicans are opposed to liberal public preferences.
files.label: LaxPhillipsAJPSmodified.csv

dataFile.description: One of two primary replication data files. Replication data from Lax & Phillips (2012). Includes state policies on 39 issues in 2008, as well as state-level public support for each of the policies. The data also include 2008 levels of several control variables. We adjusted the coding of legislative and gubernatorial party opposition so that Democrats are opposed to conservative public preferences and Republicans are opposed to liberal public preferences.

files.description: R code to apply the technique of multilevel regression with poststratification (MRP). Outputs include the file MRP_state_estimates.csv (containing our public opinion forecasts for 2014) and the multilevel models reported in the Appendix. Required input files are CCES14_UGA_OUTPUT_subset.dta, ACS2014_poststratification.dta, and state_level_update.dta.
files.label: MRP_CCES2014.R

dataFile.description: R code to apply the technique of multilevel regression with poststratification (MRP). Outputs include the file MRP_state_estimates.csv (containing our public opinion forecasts for 2014) and the multilevel models reported in the Appendix. Required input files are CCES14_UGA_OUTPUT_subset.dta, ACS2014_poststratification.dta, and state_level_update.dta.

files.description: Our predictions of state-level public opinion in 2014 on the seven policy issues we study. These predictions were produced by applying multilevel regression with poststratification to the 2014 University of Georgia CCES module and the 2014 American Community Survey.
files.label: MRP_state_estimates.csv

dataFile.description: Our predictions of state-level public opinion in 2014 on the seven policy issues we study. These predictions were produced by applying multilevel regression with poststratification to the 2014 University of Georgia CCES module and the 2014 American Community Survey.

files.description: State-level covariates provided from Lax & Phillips (2012), with more recent variables also added.
files.label: state_level_update.tab

dataFile.description: State-level covariates provided from Lax & Phillips (2012), with more recent variables also added.
